titleStmt.author: Cruso, John

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOURABLE HENRIE Lord MATRAVERS, Lord Lieutenant of his Majesties forces in Norfolk and Norwich.
analytic.author: Cruso, John

monogr.title: The art of warre, or Militarie discourses : of leavying, marching, encamping; and embattailing an armie. Of building, defending, and expugning forts and fortified cities. Of ordinance, petards, and fireworks. Of the severall duties of officers, and souldiers. Of the Grecian, and Romane militia, and forming of battaillons; &c. By the Lord of Praissac. Englished by I.C
monogr.author: Du Praissac, sieur

div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONOURABLE HENRIE Lord MATRAVERS, Lord Lieutenant of his Majesties forces in Norfolk and Norwich.
div.p:
IT was the opinion of Cato, Vel otii nostri reddendam esse rationem; In conformitie whereunto I have lately spent some idle houres in bringing noble du Praissac to speak English. An excellent principall, as your Lordship (who are no stranger to the forrain tongues) will doubtlesse judge it, •• ough but meanly coppied. Such as it is • our Lordships many and continued fa
• ours, do embolden me (in all humble sub
• ission) to present it to your Lordship, and • ith it the bounden and dutifull service of

closer.signed: your Honours devoted and obliged servant JO. CRUSO.
